Class DynamicObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • jig.engine.Sprite
      • jig.engine.physics.Body
        • DynamicObject
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    jig.engine.Viewable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Destination, Frogger, ObstacleFive, ObstacleFour, ObstacleOne, ObstacleThree, ObstacleTwo, Pad, SecondaryPad, WeatherBuild

    public class DynamicObject
extends jig.engine.physics.Body
    An abstract class to be used for all objects that aren't static, such as our frog, obstacles, and even the weather. Extends the Body class provided to us by the Java Instructional Game Engine.
    Version:
    May 5, 2016
    Author:
    Vaishnav Balaji, Period: 5th, Assignment: Frogger Final Project, Sources: None

      java.util.List<Colliders> collisionDetection

      • refresh

        public void refresh(jig.engine.util.Vector2D xy)
        Resets the level once a frog has died. This method ensures that all the moving objects return to their original place once the frog is at the beginning
        Parameters:
        xy - location (vector) at which the object is currently at

      • update

        public void update(long time)
        Updates the position of the moving objects on the screen and changes their velocity based on the level at which the user is currently at
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        time - the system's time tracker
